results.title: Life in the woodlot
results.creator_credit: Hugh O'Connor, ONF | NFB and Dalton Muir
results.brief_description: A surprising peek into the hidden world of the underbrush where silent, relentless rivalry is concealed by overhanging foliage or carpets of woodland flowers. What the film brings into focus is a pyramid of life in which lower orders of fauna sustain and support the higher orders. In the plant world we see a similar struggle for supremacy.

results.title: Life in the waves: a story about Island Surfboards
results.brief_description:
Sandy Ryan’s life revolves around surfing, helping his dad run ‘Island Surfboards’ on Phillip Island in south-eastern Victoria, and teaching others how to ride waves. Matt’s best mate and mentor, Glyndyn, is an ex-pro surfer that shapes boards for ‘Island Surfboards’ and doesn’t mind a surf either.
This is a story about a mateship, keeping it local and living the surfing lifestyle dream.

results.title: Life in the trees
results.creator_credit: John Sparks, Richard Attenborough, Reiner Moritz Productions, Warner Bros Pictures and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Life on Earth”.
David Attenborough examines the evolution of the primates. As well as looking at the better known members of the ape family - monkeys, gorillas and chimpanzees - it also looks at some of the lesser known cousins. This episode contains the memorable scene where David Attenborough meets a group of young mountain gorillas in Zaire.

group_siblings.title: The Swarming hordes
group_siblings.creator_credit: David Attenborough, Christopher Parsons, John Sparks, Richard Brock and British Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: Life in the sea: survival
results.brief_description: It is the first rule of life in the wild : eat or be eaten. In this video students will learn about some of the ways that marine creatures have adapted to this constant struggle. They will see that an animal’s survival in the ocean depends on numerous defensive techniques. Sometimes these defensive strategies work, and sometimes they don’t. If an animal’s defenses are not adequate, it will be eaten. On the other hand, if a predator is unable to overcome the defenses of it’s potential food source, it may starve. The methods used by animals to survive in the sea can be ingenious, unusual and wonderful. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s Guide included.

results.title: Life in the Sahara
results.creator_credit: Clifford J. Kamen Productions and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A view of life in the cities, on the farms and in the nomad caravans of the Sahara Desert. How trains, trucks, cars and aeroplanes carry supplies to the cities and camel caravans transport food and supplies to remote tribes. Emphasises the importance of water to the desert inhabitants and shows a diver risking his life to keep an artesian well free from clogging sand.

results.title: Life in the Pyrenees
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional and J. Arthur Rank Organisation
results.brief_description: The annual round of events in the daily lives of the local peasantry. In winter the mountains are covered with snow; when spring comes, shepherds move village animals to fresh pastures in the hills. Throughout the summer the animals roam over mountain pasture; butter and cheese making, cutting and hauling of timber and harvesting takes place in this season. The life of the village is quickened in tempo by the near approach of winter.

results.title: Life in the Orkneys
results.creator_credit: Alan Harper and Films of Scotland Committee
results.brief_description: An impression of life in the Orkneys. Surveys the history of the islands. Shows the mechanised farms which carry herds of beef and dairy cattle, sheep and other livestock. Mentions local industries, including poultry, cheese and whiskey making. Describes the community life of the islanders today, including art exhibitions, music and drama performances.

results.title: Life in the ocean
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Film Associates of California
results.brief_description: The many types of living things found in the sea are described, with emphasis on the relationships of these marine plants and animals to each other and to similar living things on land. The film was shot from inside an oceanarium in the Pacific Ocean and shows the various creatures in great detail.

results.title: Life in the Nile Valley
results.brief_description: Traces the course of the Nile River from Aswan north to Cairo. Within the narrow valley of the river, 15,000,000 people live - essentially an agricultural society which has been dependant on the Nile for many hundreds of years. A study is made of the daily activities of a typical Egyptian farm family; the ploughing and irrigation of the land, unaltered since ancient times; the home life of the women and school activities.

results.title: Life in the lowlands: the Netherlands
results.brief_description: Shows life in the polda lands of Holland with emphasis on the theme of man’s eternal struggle against nature. Demonstrates how dams and dikes are constructed and shows typical characteristics of the land; windmills, modes of transport, industries and life on the dairy farm.
